page.title: 04 The Pedestrian System.
page.content: The original development plans stated that it was necessary to create strongly defined pedestrian routes within the area itself and to all adjacent areas.Along the main N-S and E-W spines were to be located all the schools, shops, community buildings and major open spaces and play areas. A survey of the two spines revealed the following:- The north-south spine prvides convenient access to a children's playground, the local centre on the Local Authority estate,the sport's stadium and Glascote Comprehensive school.Located along the east-west spine are Belgrave Comprehensive school, a sports centre and a park with pavilion. There are three danger points where the N-S spine runs close to the main road and where both spines cross Marlborough Way via Pelican Crossings.
